definition[0]: to move with a quick sudden movement, or to make part of your body move in this way
example[0]: Wilcox jerked his head to indicate that they should move on.
example[1]: ‘Is that the only way out of here?’ he asked, jerking a thumb at the door.
example[2]: The sound of the phone jerked me awake.
example[3]: Suddenly, he jerked back in his chair.
definition[1]: to pull something suddenly and roughly
example[4]: She jerked open the car door and got out.
example[5]: Doyle jerked at the girl’s hair to make her sit down.
example[6]: He gave a sudden jerk of his head.
example[7]: She started the car with a jerk and hit the bumper of the car in front.
definition[3]: someone, especially a man, who is stupid or who does things that annoy or hurt other people
example[8]: I swore at him for being such a jerk.
